TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed FileAttribute extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates the file attributes to use when calling file-access functions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you call the `Dir`, `GetAttr`, or `SetAttr` functions, you can use the `FileAttribute` enumeration in your code in place of the actual values.
The `Attributes` argument takes the `FileAttribute` enumeration members.
When performing file I/O operations, the `My.Computer.FileSystem` object provides greater performance and ease of use than legacy file I/O methods. For more information, see <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileSystem> .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileAttribute Archive = int32(32)

Docs.summary: File has changed since last backup. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileAttribute Directory = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Directory or folder. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileAttribute Hidden = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Hidden. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileAttribute Normal = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Normal (default for and ). No special characteristics apply to this file. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileAttribute ReadOnly = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Read only. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileAttribute System = int32(4)

Docs.summary: System file. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileAttribute Volume = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Volume label. This attribute is not valid when used with . This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .
